attributes.comment:
I am a Citizenship teacher for the Los Angeles Unified School District. I have seen,
over a decade, the fee for naturalization rise from less than $100 to the present
$330. The proposed increase to $595 makes the process even more expensive
and places naturalization further out of reach for many permanent residents. While
the process is smoother than it was in the 1990s, the numbers are also much
reduced, and I don't understand why the USCIS needs to continue increasing fees
so drastically. A large number of immigrants in Los Angeles have been permanent
residents for many years but have never pursued naturalization. The proposed fee
increase discourages, instead of encourages, them to pursue naturalization, which
I would think is the opposite of what the USCIS should be doing.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Gregory A. Dobie
